programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: Investigator Jack Reacher leaps off the pages of Lee Child's novel and onto the big screen in this thriller. When a horrible crime is committed, all evidence points to the suspect in custody, who offers up a single note in defense: "Get Jack Reacher!"

programme.title: Cliffhanger
programme.desc: This gripping action-adventure tale features Sylvester Stallone as a member of the Rocky Mountain Rescue Team, still grieving over his inability to prevent a friend from falling to her death.

programme.title: Universal Soldier: The Return
programme.desc: The "universal soldiers" must fight the whole army, when the military's supercomputer S.E.T.H gets out of control.

programme.title: Naked Science
programme.desc: Throughout history, the earth has been bombarded from space. Asteroid impacts have caused mass extinctions â€“ including the dinosaur wipe out.
programme.sub-title: How To Avert an Asteroid Impact

programme.title: Naked Science
programme.desc: Saturn is the second-largest planet in the solar system. Storms on this gas giant can cover an area bigger than the United States Clouds of the gas race around the planet at over 1000 miles per hour generating fierce electrical storms and lightning.

programme.title: Naked Science
programme.desc: Superflares are amongst the greatest events of the Universe. These magnetic explosions can release energy millions of times greater than atomic bombs. They produce streams of highly energetic particles which can be highly destructive to life.
programme.sub-title: Super Flares - Could They Cause Mass Extinction?

programme.title: Naked Science
programme.desc: By far the largest planet, 1300 times the size of Earth, itâ€™s a world so enormous it could swallow every planet and moon in the solar system and still have room to spare.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Space: Getting There
programme.desc: The new surge in space transportation, privately owned companies vying for government contracts and private entrepreneurs looking to build hotels in space.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Danger, Asteroids Ahead
programme.desc: The threat of an asteroid strike is a very real danger in our solar system, mankind is now in a position to defend the planet from such an eventuality.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Danger, Asteroids Ahead
programme.desc: The threat of an asteroid strike is a very real danger in our solar system, mankind is now in a position to defend the planet from such an eventuality.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Atmosphere
programme.desc: Our atmosphere is an unbelievably complex machine that protects us from the vacuum of space, shelters us from harmful radiation and allows us and the biosphere to breath; we need to learn much more about it so we can better it.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Return to the Moon
programme.desc: The moon is our closest celestial companion. It lights our night sky and gently tugs at our shores. Few have walked on her surface, but her allure remains strong.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: From There to Here
programme.desc: The sky above is studded with stars and countless galaxies. In them, we can read not only our origin, but also our final destination. Technology is on the brink of taking us to places we have only dreamed of.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Space: Getting There
programme.desc: The new surge in space transportation, privately owned companies vying for government contracts and private entrepreneurs looking to build hotels in space.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Orbit
programme.desc: Chances are, you are watching this program by satellite, one way or the other. Every day we use these wonders of human design, from communication and weather observation, to GPS and recourse management.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Night Fire
programme.desc: The Northern Lights are more than just beautiful; they tell us about the make up of our planet, our sun, and may even be a signpost for the possibility of life on other planets.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Virtual Universe
programme.desc: Our understanding of the cosmos is limited by the amount of time we have to see it. Fortunately, computer simulations can help us see how galaxies interact over millions of years, and even how dark matter structures the universe.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Stargazer's Paradise
programme.desc: The Atacama desert is a perfect place for watching the night sky. With still winds and only a handful of cloudy nights each year, it allows scientists to get the absolute most out of their tools.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Hubble's Renaissance
programme.desc: Before we can reach space, we must first be able to see it. Hundreds of years ago, the simple telescope was used to give us a seemingly closer vantage. Today, we use the awe-inspiring, and super powerful, Hubble Space Telescope.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Superscopes
programme.desc: Discover the most powerful telescopes on the planet as they search for the mysteries of the universe.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Cosmic Rainbow
programme.desc: The human eye can only see visible light, a small spectrum of electromagnetic waves. Today, we have instruments that let us perceive all wavelengths.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Seasons of Saturn
programme.desc: Saturn is the second largest planet and has an astonishing 60 moons in its orbit. Thanks to the Cassini mission, itâ€™s also one of the most studied and most photographed planets in our neighborhood.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Vesta Unveiled
programme.desc: With the Dawn missions exploration of the asteroid Vesta and the dwarf planet Ceres, asteroids are a hot topic. See what these incredible missions have uncovered.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Water Worlds
programme.desc: They key ingredient to life in the universe is water. Until recently we thought Earth was the only place in the solar system to have any water at all. Now that probes are peering around nearby worlds we are finding that is just not the case.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Gravity
programme.desc: Gravity has long been a force that has intrigued scientists. Now, for the first time scientists are probing to detect gravity waves in space as well as mapping the gravity patterns of the moon.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Science and the Shuttle
programme.desc: For more than 25 years the shuttle was our ticket to space, and our laboratory in orbit. Uncover the legacy of this amazing machine, and see what lies ahead.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Landing on Mars
programme.desc: Mars sparks our curiosity like no other planet because it is so reachable. Despite having landed there, most of the information we gather is still done by instruments in the planet's orbit.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Milky Way
programme.desc: This episode traces our view of the Milky Way, from the mythology of ancient skywatchers to the efforts of scientists to map it from the inside out.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: The Big Bang
programme.desc: When it comes to the birth of the universe, not even the most creative work of imagination can rival what science has revealed about the Big Bang.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: The Hot Zone
programme.desc: Mercury is one of Earth's closest neighbors, but until very recent exploratory missions, it eluded astronomers' best efforts to learn its secrets.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Cosmic Rays
programme.desc: Cosmic rays can tell us much about the universe. They are not simply another form of light, but carriers of information about powerful and unseen processes at work thousands or even millions of light years away.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: The Fermi Paradox
programme.desc: The Fermi Paradox asks the ultimate question: why have alien civilizations not presented themselves?

programme.title: Playing with Fire
programme.desc: When firefighter Jake Carson (John Cena) and his team (Keegan-Michael Key & John Leguizamo) rescue three siblings in the path of a wildfire, they realize no amount of training could have prepared them for their most challenging job yet -- babysitting.

programme.title: Caddyshack
programme.desc: It's the snobs against the slobs! While caddy Danny tries to impress elitist Judge Smails, a crude construction tycoon tries getting accepted at the country club, and a groundskeeper stalks a gopher.

programme.title: Clue
programme.desc: Meet all the notorious suspects and discover all their foul play things. You'll love their dastardly doings as the bodies and the laughs pile up before your eyes. Featuring all three surprise endings!!

programme.title: Don't Tell Mom the Babysitter's Dead
programme.desc: Tanya finds her summer plans canceled when her mom jets off for a last-minute retreat and the elderly babysitter who arrives at her door unexpectedly passes away.

programme.desc: Meet all the notorious suspects and discover all their foul play things. You'll love their dastardly doings as the bodies and the laughs pile up before your eyes. Featuring all three surprise endings!!

programme.desc: When firefighter Jake Carson (John Cena) and his team (Keegan-Michael Key & John Leguizamo) rescue three siblings in the path of a wildfire, they realize no amount of training could have prepared them for their most challenging job yet -- babysitting.

programme.desc: A pair of detectives investigate a murder while pursuing their other full-time professions. Welcome to Hollywood Homicide - the only place where you can come to work hungry, horny, thirsty, and broke, and resolve all four by the end of the watch.

programme.title: Titanic
programme.desc: Leonardo DiCaprio and Oscar-nominee Kate Winslet light up the screen as Jack and Rose, the young lovers who find one another on the maiden voyage of the "unsinkable" R.M.S. Titanic.

programme.title: Shakespeare In Love

programme.desc: Exploring Windsor Castle, the world's oldest and largest inhabited castle.

programme.title: The Queen's Palaces
programme.desc: Edinburgh's Palace of Holyroodhouse is the least-known but most romantic of the royal palaces.

programme.title: Sandringham: A Royal Residence
programme.desc: Be transported back to 1862 when the building first came into royal hands; Nigel Havers reveals that it was Queen Victoria who snapped up the original Sandringham Hall as a 21st birthday present for her party-loving son Prince Bertie.

programme.title: Sandringham: A Royal Residence
programme.desc: The death of Edward VII in 1910 rocks Sandringham and the royals; the privately-owned house was inherited by Edward VII's wife, Alexandra; how the abdication crisis threw the very future of the house into question.

programme.title: Sandringham: A Royal Residence
programme.desc: A look at 1952, when tragedy struck as King George VI died in his sleep, discovering what happened as the new Queen began her reign.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: Chef Blanc focuses on tomatoes, opening with a simple salad recipe inspired by his mother; he also makes a creamy risotto, stuffed tomatoes glazed with cheese and a series of ices and sorbets to cleanse the palate with elegance.

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella introduces her love of Italian food through a spectacular yet simple Sicilian pasta with tomatoes, garlic and almonds, and a mid-week family feast of tagliata.

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella Lawson shares the secrets of her Italian roast chicken, served alongside a saffron orzotto; Nigella prepares coffee ice cream for dessert, inspired by the ice cream parlors of Florence; a chocolate olive oil cake provides an extra treat.

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Pork loin stuffed with Parma ham and oregano, served alongside her speedy mock mash and lazy person's vignarola.

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Liquorice pudding; Sardinian sun-dried and toasted couscous; butterflied leg of lamb; baby aubergines with oregano and roasted red onion.

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella starts with her take on a light and sunny yogurt pot cake; she recruits her niece and nephew to make a shortcut sausage meatball supper; Nigella prepares squid and prawns with marjoram and chili; a tiramisini ends the evening.

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Lamb chops with mint; chilli and golden potatoes; ruby red plum and amoretti crumble; farro risotto with mushrooms.

programme.title: Flour Power
programme.desc: In Moray at the Forres branch of Moray Coast Vets, veterinary surgeons Mark and Johanna, veterinary nurse Anna, and student veterinary nurse Kristin create cakes.

programme.title: Flour Power
programme.desc: At John Gillespie hairdressing salon in Perth, owner John, salon director Glen, creative director Fiona and colorist Rachel swap their scissors for scales and mixing bowls as they go head-to-head for the "Flour Power" trophy.

programme.title: Flour Power
programme.desc: Private client solicitor Dara, senior solicitor Rachael and family solicitor Emma are joined by rookie cake-maker and document manager Jonny where they compete and bake against each other at Aberdeen law firm Ledingham Chalmers.

programme.title: Flour Power
programme.desc: The team visits the Bruichladdich distillery on the Hebridean island of Islay where four colleagues compete for the trophy.

programme.title: Flour Power
programme.desc: The team goes to the Tron Theatre in Glasgow where four employees battle for the Flour Power trophy.

programme.title: Flour Power
programme.desc: Four coworkers at Cyrenians charity for the homeless compete in a bake off.

programme.title: Flour Power
programme.desc: At Perth's Cairn O'Mohr Winery, boss Ron competes against sales manager Linzey C, tour guide Linsay D, and production worker Kay.

programme.title: Flour Power
programme.desc: Employees from graphic and brand consultancy Avian and web design and development agency Blue2 of Broughty Ferry compete for the Flour Power trophy.

programme.title: Flour Power
programme.desc: A visit to The Old Mart Resource Centre in Maud, Aberdeenshire, on the former site of one of the U.K.'s biggest cattle markets.

programme.title: Flour Power
programme.desc: At Live Language in Glasglow, one of Scotland's busiest language schools, it is a multilingual affair as Ruba, Tatiana, Nana, and Marcus battle it out for the Flour Power trophy.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: The series starts in autumnal Bordeaux. Rick arrives just in time to judge a local wine contest, and hires a 2CV for an excursion to the coast - abundant with mussels and oysters.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick Stein enjoys a winter break in Reykjavik in search of the perfect cod and sampling succulent fjord-reared roast lamb.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick enjoys a weekend in Berlin, where history and the avant garde dwell enticingly side by side. A city that once made history with its divisive wall teems today with an overwhelming array of innovative chefs offering delicious seasonal creations.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick Stein visits Vienna, the city that once ran the Austro-Hungarian Empire. It is home to comfort dishes like tafelspitz and goulash, and it also gave its name to one of Europe's most popular dishes, the wiener schnitzel.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick visits Bologna in northern Italy, a city so famous for its food that it's known as the stomach of Italy. He learns how to make the local fresh egg pasta used for tortellini, tagliatelle, ravioli and lasagne.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick Stein visits Lisbon on the banks of the River Tagus, a city in love with its seafood and possibly the best custard tarts in the world. The culinary effects of Portugal's historic explorations are still seen in its dishes.

programme.desc: Amy Murgatroyd remembers something vital while attempting to re-enact the murder, but then she is strangled.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: When the body of newlywed Lisa Moore is found in a room for which she had no key, minutes after her wedding, it's discovered that she may have been having an affair with her murderer.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: When voodoo priestess Angelique Morel does a reading and learns she will be murdered, and then is actually poisoned, questions arise as to who could do this and how it leads back to members of her family.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: After a woman arrives at the police station to confess she killed her bullying husband, no corpse can be found.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Richard's job is on the line after someone is murdered while handcuffed to him.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Dwayne and Fidel must solve the apparently impossible murder of a local diver.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A womanizing lead vocalist of a recently reformed band is found dead on stage and while the other band members think it was a suicide, Poole isn't convinced.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A woman with two identities is found murdered in her bed with her house ransacked and Poole discovers she was about to expose a money-laundering scheme.

programme.title: The Motherhood
programme.desc: Tasha poured everything into being a mom, but lost herself. With support from The Motherhood, Tasha learns to set boundaries, reclaim her space, and rediscover her confidence, ...

programme.title: Along Came a Nanny
programme.desc: Detective Mike Logan takes on a special undercover assignment as a nanny when a quiet, upscale neighborhood is turned upside down by a string of robberies. When the mystery begins to unravel, new relationships are threatened.

programme.title: In My Dreams
programme.desc: Natalie and Nick have no luck in romance. After tossing coins into a fountain, the two then begin dreaming about each other. But, according to fountain mythology, they only have a week to turn those dreams into reality.

programme.title: Pack of Lies
programme.desc: A thriller about a middle class family which are suddenly thrown into a world of international intrigue. Stars Ellen Burstyn and Alan Bates.

programme.title: Loving Leah
programme.desc: When Leah's husband Benjamin dies suddenly, Benjamin's brother Jake is stunned to learn he is expected to marry Leah to carry on the name. Jake suggests to Leah that they get married and maintain a secretly platonic relationship.

programme.title: Crossroads: A Story of Forgiveness
programme.desc: Bruce Murakami discovers that the tragic accident that killed his wife and daughter was the result of a street racing incident.

programme.title: Karen Kingsbury's A Time to Dance
programme.desc: John and Abby were once the perfect couple. Now, after 21 years, they are about to lose it all. But when their daughter announces her engagement, they secretly agree to put their divorce plans on hold.

programme.title: Kiss at Pine Lake
programme.desc: Luke Garvey buys his uncle's Camp Pine Lake only to find himself the owner of a sinking business. Zoe McConnell, Luke's girlfriend from years ago, wants him to sell until an old flame is rekindled.

programme.title: Better Call Saul
programme.desc: Jimmy and Kim go to great lengths to right a wrong.

programme.title: Better Call Saul
programme.desc: Jimmy and Kim have it out. Mike has cause to worry.

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Upon arrival in Zimbabwe, Kristina Guberman heads to Hwange National Park - renowned for it's impressive elephant herds. She learns about these gentle giants, encounters cheetah on foot and chances upon a cheetah hunt.

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Kristina travels to the Mana Pools National Park with guide Craig van Zyl. They come across mating lions, have close encounters with bull elephants and canoe just meters away from imposing hippos and crocodiles on the mighty Zambezi River.

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Wildlife guide, Craig accompanies Kristina to one of the wildest places in Zimbabwe â€“ Chitake Springs, aka, Ambush Alley. They get up close to a huge bull elephant and Kristina has her first- ever sighting of endangered wild dogs.

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Wildlife guide, Craig accompanies Kristina to one of the wildest places in Zimbabwe â€“ Chitake Springs, aka, Ambush Alley. They get up close to a huge bull elephant and Kristina has her first- ever sighting of endangered wild dogs.

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Still at Victoria Falls, Kristina is treated to an aerial view of the Victoria falls. She gets up close and personal with prehistoric-looking beasts at the croc sanctuary and experiences some of the must-do tourist activities.

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Guided by Sean, Kristina explores the Matusadona National Park where they have incredible on- foot encounters with elephants and lions. Will she keep her cool as she comes face-to-face with one of Africa's apex predators?

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Kristina remains at Changa where she is treated to game-viewing by helicopter, tries her hand at fishing and witnesses lions stalking buffalo.

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: With Lawrence as her guide, Kristina embarks on an entertaining horse-back safari, interacts with Jasmine the giraffe, has a relaxing canoe trip and meets the clever resident elephant herd.

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Kristina visits Imire Rhino and Wildlife Conservancy where she is shown around by the founder's grandson, Riley. She has the opportunity to learn about and interact with elephants that have been trained to track poachers.
programme.sub-title: Imire Rhino and Wild Life Conservancy

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: The adventure continues as Kristina journeys to Far and Wide in mountainous Nyanga, Eastern Zimbabwe. Her guide Bernie begins the trip with some extreme adventure sports including braving the tallest zip line on the planet.

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Kristina visits Thetford Estate where she's treated to amazing photographic opportunities for her personal calendar.

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Kristina travels back to Zimbabwe's stunning lake Kariba. This time she's touring the area on the luxurious Karabezi Houseboat Cruiser. Joined by fishing experts, Craig and Mark, she attempts to catch the infamous tiger fish.

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Hosted by Rhino Safari Camp, the epic safari continues back in the Matusadona National Park where Kristina is guided by Steve.

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Kristina travels to Gonarezhou National Park in the South-East of Zimbabwe. Thomas, her guide, takes her to the breath-taking Chilojo cliffs, tracks an impressive buffalo herd and keeps his cool as they experience heart-stopping elephant charges.

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Craig joins Kristina at Sango Lodge in the heart of the Save Valley Conservancy where they explore the vast, rugged wilderness. Kristina joins Byrce Clemence and his anti-poaching team as they demonstrate the effectiveness of the anti-poaching dog unit.

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Back on the banks of Lake Kariba, Kristina is hosted by the luxurious Bumi Hills Safari Lodge. She tracks lions with her guide Madison, witness elephants swimming and challenges Madison to a fishing bet.

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: The safari continues at Bumi Hills Safari Lodge where Kristina joins the anti-poaching unit on their everyday, thrilling duties. The fishing challenges with Madison continue and the breath-taking lakeshore game viewing experiences keep coming.

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Kristina travels back to Mana Pools to experience the untamed wilderness in the extreme dry season. Her guide, Cloud, takes her on an expedition to find lion cubs and wild dog puppies. Will they find what they are looking for?

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Still based at Zambezi Expeditions Camp, Richard guides Kristina into her closest encounter with a wild bull elephant. An evening excursion to Kanga Pan leads to breath-taking sightings of elusive creatures of the night.

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Kristina heads to Camp Amalinda on the edge of the Matopos National Park. Her guide, Dardley, shares some of the history of this World Heritage Site and intriguing rock paintings.

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Dardley joins Kristina at Ivory Lodge on the edge of Hwange National Park where her predator sightings just keep getting better. They get unbelievably close to wild cheetah and witness something incredible.
programme.sub-title: Ivory Safari Lodge and Khulu Lodge

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Kristina's guide, Andy, treats her to wonderful riverbed drives and wild encounters on foot.

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: The safari continues at Kavinga where Kristina and Andy have more interactions with Juno, the resident lion king. A late drive leads them to the predators of the night.

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Kristina is back with Sean and hosted at the Hide Safari Camp in Hwange National Park at their driest period. A night drive leads them to a unique finding.

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS

programme.desc: Aired 10/14/2017. As deforestation rages and unique species vanish, the fight is on to save one of the planetâ€™s most special places before it is ruined forever.
programme.sub-title: Madagascar: The Richest Poor Country in the World

programme.title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day
programme.desc: The non-human machine ruling elite of the nuclear war-torn future has dispatched a cyborg assassin into the past to kill a young boy because he soon will be the resistance leader against the machines.

programme.title: Terminator Genisys
programme.desc: When John Connor sends Kyle Reese back to 1984 to protect a young Sarah Connor, unexpected events alter the past and threaten the future for all mankind. Charged with a new mission, Reese must join forces with Sarah and her "Guardian" to save the world.

programme.title: Terminator: Dark Fate
programme.desc: An enhanced super soldier teams up with battle-hardened Sarah Connor (Linda Hamilton) and an unexpected ally (Arnold Schwarzenegger) to stop the deadliest Terminator yet. Humanity's fate hangs in the balance in this action-packed thrill ride.

programme.title: Interstellar
programme.desc: From director Christopher Nolan (Inception) comes the story of ex-pilot Cooper (Matthew McConaughey), who must leave his family and Earth behind to lead an expedition beyond this galaxy to discover whether mankind has a future among the stars.

programme.title: Drive
programme.desc: A Hollywood stunt performer (Ryan Gosling) who moonlights as a wheelman discovers that a contract has been put on him after a heist gone wrong.

programme.title: Air
programme.desc: From award-winning director Ben Affleck, Air reveals the game-changing partnership between a then undiscovered Michael Jordan and Nikeâ€™s fledgling basketball division which revolutionized the world of sports and culture with the Air Jordan brand.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Winner robots from rounds one through five battle it out in the arena, a wild card from the runners up throws a spanner in the works as it tries to overthrow attempts at glory.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Learn more about this infamous Robot and the family that built it. With an unforgettable design and devastating weapon, the Hypno-Disc competitor became an instant icon.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Debuting in the Second Wars, to becoming the most successful Robot ever to take part in Robot Wars. The Razer Robot put the squeeze on all the competition, including the House Robots.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Dogs enter the ring as they munch and crunch their way into victory. Some will let off steam while others sends out flames of destruction.

programme.title: Robot Wars: Extreme
programme.desc: Craig Charles and Philippa Forrester oversee the mechanical mayhem. Jonathan Pearce supplies his inimitable brand of commentary and in-depth analysis.

programme.title: Robot Wars: Extreme
programme.desc: Craig Charles and Philippa Forrester oversee the mechanical mayhem. Jonathan Pearce supplies his inimitable brand of commentary and in-depth analysis.

programme.desc: Craig Charles and Philippa Forrester oversee the mechanical mayhem. The grown-ups take a back seat as the kids control the robots.

programme.title: Robot Wars: Extreme

programme.title: Robot Wars: Extreme
programme.desc: Contestants pit their lean, mean fighting machines against each other, in a bid to become Robot Wars: New Blood Champions.

programme.title: Robot Wars: Extreme
programme.desc: `Chip' from Prestatyn, `Hell's Teeth' from Mablethorpe and Boston's 1`RT81' find out what it's like to play with the big boys in the warzone.

programme.title: Robot Wars: Extreme
programme.desc: `Mad Dog' from Romford, `Storm II' from Martlesham Heath and Handworth's `Direct Action' experience the brutality of the House Robots and the harsh reality of the war-zone.

programme.title: Robot Wars: Extreme
programme.desc: `Piranha' from Northbourne, Brentford's `Bash Gordon' and `Fatal Traction' from Edgbaston encounter each other and the House Robots for the very first time.

programme.title: Robot Wars: Extreme
programme.desc: A series of special episodes of `Robot Wars' where contestants build fighting robots to pit against one another in a battle to the death.

programme.title: Robot Wars: Extreme
programme.desc: The heavyweights take a back seat as the middleweights, lightweights, featherweights, and antweights take to the floor, but being smaller does not mean they do not bite.

programme.title: Robot Wars: Extreme
programme.desc: Eight battle-hardened robots, with their sights set on glory, fight it out for the right to take on current champion `Tornado' for the coveted Challenge Belt.

programme.title: Robot Wars: Extreme
programme.desc: The ladies show the men a thing or two in the Iron Maidens tournament.

programme.title: Robot Wars: Extreme
programme.desc: The best undergraduate engineering brains in the country show off their expertise by battling it out in the war-zone with their robotic creations.

programme.title: Robot Wars: Extreme
programme.desc: Robots from as far afield as Australia and Canada do battle in the war zone, against homegrown talent such as `Firestorm III' from England and `Panic Attack' from Wales.

programme.desc: In this anime classic, a powerful wind has left all memories erased. Two years later, a young man travels on a journey to find the truth about the apocalyptic wind.

programme.title: God Mars
programme.desc: In this anime spinoff of the sci-fi television series, Takeru has been sent from a distant planet to destroy the earth. However, as he learns of the beauty of the earth and its inhabitants, he begins to question his mission.

programme.title: Blue Thermal
programme.desc: Tamaki becomes a captive of the vast beauty of the skies from the moment Kuramochi takes her under his wing and up for a flight in a glider.

programme.title: Fortune Favors Lady Nikuko
programme.desc: The story of a mother and daughter and their lives aboard a boat in a fishing town.

programme.title: The Last Legion
programme.desc: As the Roman empire collapses, young Romulus Augustus must leave the city and set out for a dangerous journey to Britain to locate his last legion of supporters.

programme.title: The Negotiator
programme.desc: The tables turn when a seasoned hostage negotiator takes hostages and risks all to prove his own innocence.

programme.title: The Silver Brumby
programme.desc: In the unforgiving wilderness of the Australian Alps, there roams a stallion like no other, the Silver Brumby. Now, one horseman sets off on an unforgettable adventure to capture the horse that according to legend, could never be tamed.

programme.title: In Time
programme.desc: Justin Timberlake and Amanda Seyfried co-star in this sci-fi thriller set in a future world where aging stops at 25, and the only way for one man to stay alive is to steal more time.

programme.title: Cybermutt
programme.desc: The powerful dog Rex is injured by a car while rescuing a young scientist from being run over. Feeling responsible for the condition of Rex the scientist uses his skill as a prosthetics inventor to give the dog a new, super-power body.

programme.title: Meet Dave
programme.desc: A crew of miniature aliens operate a spaceship that has a human form

programme.title: High Crimes
programme.desc: A woman's life becomes embroiled in a huge military cover-up when it's revealed her husband is not who he says he is.

programme.title: In Time
programme.desc: Justin Timberlake and Amanda Seyfried co-star in this sci-fi thriller set in a future world where aging stops at 25, and the only way for one man to stay alive is to steal more time.

programme.title: Stolen
programme.desc: A former thief frantically searches for his missing daughter, who has been kidnapped and locked in the trunk of a taxi. Starring Nicolas Cage and Malin Akerman.

programme.title: High Crimes
programme.desc: A woman's life becomes embroiled in a huge military cover-up when it's revealed her husband is not who he says he is.

programme.title: To the Ends of Time
programme.desc: In a mythical kingdom, a young boy must fight time itself for the love of his princess and the future of his land.

programme.title: The Dark Crystal
programme.desc: On another planet in the distant past, a Gelfling embarks on a quest to find the missing shard of a magical crystal, and to restore order to his world.

programme.title: Cadia: The World Within
programme.desc: Devastated by the loss of their mother, three teens discover a mystical realm ruled by unseen forces and must overcome evil in the order to return home.

programme.title: Good Witch
programme.desc: A raven-haired enchantress, Cassie Nightingale, mysteriously moves into the local haunted mansion, 'Grey House', and seems to change her neighbors lives using a hint of magic causing many to think sheâ€™s a witch.

programme.title: Grace and Goliath
programme.desc: Hollywood big-shot Josh Jenkins sweeps into Belfast to make a movie, but before long his world crashes and he loses everything. Hotel cleaner Lily invites him to stay with her family and gradually the people of this 'strange' city touch his heart forever.

programme.title: F.R.E.D.I.
programme.desc: Prepare for an adventure that's out of this world! When an intelligent, lovable robot, known as F.R.E.D.I., goes missing from a secret government research facility it's found by 15 year old James.

programme.title: Wish Upon a Star: Wish Upon a Star
programme.desc: In this cult classic, younger sister Hayley Wheaton (Danielle Harris) wishes to switch places with her popular older sister Alexia (Katherine Heigl) and the two bickering siblings awaken to find the wish has come true.

programme.title: Storm Boy
programme.desc: When Michael Kingley, a successful retired businessman starts to see images from his past that he can't explain, he's forced to remember his childhood and how, as a boy, he rescued and raised an extraordinary orphaned pelican, Mr Percival.

programme.title: The Simple Life of Noah Dearborn
programme.desc: Academy Award winners Sidney Poitier and Dianne Wiest star with Mary-Louise Parker in this enchanting tale about a quiet hero who becomes the talk of the town.

programme.title: Heaven Must Wait
programme.desc: An American inherits an old village church in England, where treasure is buried. Greedy Mr. Slee scents his opportunity to snatch the treasure. Diggity, a little cherub trying to earn his wings, helps uncover the treasure for the benefit of the village.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Money On The Line
programme.desc: In the first episode of a two-part season finale, Gloucester's reigning Bluefin champion Dave Carraro, of FV-tuna.com, starts the fishing season with a $20,000 lead over his rival.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Endgame
programme.desc: With only three days left in the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season, the captains of Gloucester race against each other - and an oncoming storm - in the battle to land their final fish of the season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Back In The Hunt
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, head for open seas in hopes of catching the first fish of the Atlantic Bluefin Tuna Season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Go Fish!
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, battle for the elusive and lucrative giant Bluefin tuna, with harpooners going up against rod-and-reelers.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Numbers War
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester battle for prime fishing spots in their quest to catch the elusive and lucrative Bluefin Tuna.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Fish Fight
programme.desc: For the tuna fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, it's tournament time, and, with a big cash prize up for grabs, the fight is on to catch the biggest bluefin.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Shark Attack
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, are facing a dangerous new foe, with great white sharks swarming into local waters.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Sweet Smell of Revenge
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, battle droves of bumbling amateur fishermen in their bid to catch lucrative Atlantic Bluefin Tuna.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Storm Warning
programme.desc: A storm is racing towards the north Atlantic fishing grounds, but with time ticking away on the bluefin tuna season, the captains have no choice but to head out to fish in the rough weather.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Hell On The High Seas
programme.desc: It is week eight of the North Atlantic Bluefin tuna fishing season, and cracks are starting to show in the Gloucester fleet, with captains and crews pushing each other to the limit.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Meltdown
programme.desc: Tensions reach their breaking point amongst the Gloucester fleet as captains, mates and vessels fall apart.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Captain Carnage
programme.desc: It's a battle of wills on the North Atlantic, as two of Gloucester's top Bluefin fishermen - friends-turned-foes Paul Hebert and Dave Carraro - go head-to-head to out-fish each other.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: All Hands On Deck
programme.desc: With only four weeks left in the Atlantic Bluefin season, two boats have the challenge of novice fishermen on board â€“ and it could make or break their season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Uncharted Territory
programme.desc: The Atlantic Bluefin are starting to migrate out of New England waters, so the Gloucester fleet races to find any edge they can, but will their risky new strategies pay off?

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Twice Bitten
programme.desc: With only two weeks left on the North Atlantic Bluefin tuna fishing season, just one fish is not enough for the Gloucester captains â€“ and the lure of doubling their luck is overpowering.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Money On The Line
programme.desc: In the first episode of a two-part season finale, Gloucester's reigning Bluefin champion Dave Carraro, of FV-tuna.com, starts the fishing season with a $20,000 lead over his rival.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Endgame
programme.desc: With only three days left in the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season, the captains of Gloucester race against each other - and an oncoming storm - in the battle to land their final fish of the season.

programme.title: Showdown at the Grand
programme.desc: A proud movie theater owner must defend his family business from corporate developers alongside a legendary action star as art imitates life in a showdown for the ages.

programme.title: The Way Of The Gun
programme.desc: A pair of bumbling criminals kidnap a woman for ransom money, but they soon realize they've made a huge mistake when they learn she is a surrogate for a ruthless mob boss.

programme.title: Showdown at the Grand
programme.desc: A proud movie theater owner must defend his family business from corporate developers alongside a legendary action star as art imitates life in a showdown for the ages.

programme.title: The Way Of The Gun
programme.desc: A pair of bumbling criminals kidnap a woman for ransom money, but they soon realize they've made a huge mistake when they learn she is a surrogate for a ruthless mob boss.

programme.title: The Art of War
programme.desc: Neil Shaw (Wesley Snipes) is an operative for the UN's covert squad, using espionage to secure peace and cooperation. After witnessing the murder of a Chinese ambassador, he is framed for the murder.

programme.title: DOUBLE BLAST
programme.desc: A master criminal/martial artist kidnaps a comely female professor, in hopes of translating a stolen ancient Utayo tablet and revealing its hidden secrets.

programme.title: AMERICAN SIEGE
programme.desc: A small-town sheriff (Bruce Willis) has to contend with a gang of thieves who have taken a wealthy doctor hostage.

programme.title: Abduction
programme.desc: When Nathan (Taylor Lautner) discovers the parents who raised him aren't his real folks, he begins to uncover unsettling secrets that trigger events and leave him running for his life.

programme.title: The Humanity Bureau
programme.desc: A dystopian thriller set in the year 2030 that sees the world in a permanent state of economic recession and facing serious environmental problems as a result of global warming.

programme.title: Comedian, The
programme.desc: An aging comic icon is forced to serve out a sentence doing community service for accosting an audience member. While there, the meets the daughter of a real estate mogul, and the two find inspiration in one another resulting in surprising consequences.

programme.title: Once Upon A Time In Venice
programme.desc: A Los Angeles detective seeks out the ruthless gang that stole his dog.

programme.title: Comedian, The
programme.desc: An aging comic icon is forced to serve out a sentence doing community service for accosting an audience member. While there, the meets the daughter of a real estate mogul, and the two find inspiration in one another resulting in surprising consequences.

programme.title: Once Upon A Time In Venice
programme.desc: A Los Angeles detective seeks out the ruthless gang that stole his dog.

programme.title: Slice
programme.desc: When a pizza delivery driver is murdered on the job, the city searches for someone to blame: ghosts? drug dealers? a disgraced werewolf?

programme.title: Sharknado: Heart of Sharkness
programme.desc: Discover the untold story of David Moore, the filmmaker who first dreamed of Â“sharks in a tornadoÂ” and brought on disaster by using real sharks. The first SHARKNADO was to be a movie never seen, a crime never reported, a tale never told. Until now.

programme.title: Made In America
programme.desc: When Zora Mathews goes searching for her biological, anonymous sperm donor father, she and her Afro-centric mother Sarah are dumbfounded to discover Hal Jackson, an obnoxious used car salesman on late-night TV; and worse than that, he's white.

programme.title: Wagons East!
programme.desc: They came for gold, but now they'll settle for indoor plumbing. John Candy and Richard Lewis star in this hilariously unconventional look at the legendary West.

programme.title: Paint
programme.desc: In PAINT, Owen Wilson portrays Carl Nargle, Vermont's #1 public television painter who is convinced he has it all: a signature perm, custom van, and fans hanging on his every stroke... until a younger, better artist steals everything Carl loves.

programme.title: A Gift of Miracles
programme.desc: A chance encounter between two strangers, through a series of small coincidences, gives one young woman a new perspective on life, love and the world's unexplained marvels.

programme.title: High Flying Romance
programme.desc: Hannah falls for more than teaching music when woodworker Gavin and his nine-year-old daughter, Parker, move back to town after his wifeâ€™s passing. With a shared interest in the upcoming kite festival...

programme.title: Unleashing Mr. Darcy
programme.desc: Idealistic dog handler Elizabeth Bennett finds herself repeatedly judged in dog show rings by philanthropist Donovan Darcy. What she doesnâ€™t count on is an unstoppable attraction to the billionaire dog breeder.

programme.title: Cooking with Love
programme.desc: Hardworking and optimistic television producer, Kelly, doesn't have time for love. Along with her mentor Amanda, Kelly dives into another season of the Little Gourmet, a kids cooking show.

programme.title: Growing The Big One
programme.desc: Personal and career circumstances force big-city radio host Emma to broadcast and web-cast from the home she inherited in rural Washington State.

programme.title: For Love And Honour CA
programme.desc: A by-the-book veteran takes over at a failing military academy and immediately clashes with the beautiful dean of academics. Eventually, sparks fly as they're forced to become close to save their school.

programme.title: Stop the Wedding
programme.desc: A career-focused San Francisco divorce attorney whose busy professional life has replaced her desire for romance. When she learns that her widowed Aunt has hastily agreed to marry a charming veteran movie star.

programme.title: Love's Portrait
programme.desc: Museum curator, Lily, finds a painting that's identical to her and searches for the artist in Ireland. There, William, a charming man joins her on her quest and helps her rediscover love.

programme.title: Over the Moon in Love
programme.desc: With her match-making business on the verge of closing, Brooklyn finds herself in the unique position to be featured in a magazine, but has to set up the writer with her childhood friend Devin.

programme.title: A Valentine's Match
programme.desc: Fired from her job as a reality TV host, Natalie returns home for Valentine's Day, only to find herself running the town festival's auction with her ex-fiancÃ© thanks to two scheming mothers.

programme.title: Blueprint to the Heart
programme.desc: Interior designer and house flipper trying to save her home improvement show needs to apply her successful 'fixer upper' home buying strategy to her blue collar contractor.

programme.title: Cranberry Christmas
programme.desc: A separated couple feign marital bliss on national television to help their town's Christmas festival - and their business. But what will be when rekindled love is complicated by new opportunities?

programme.title: Debbie Macomber's A Mrs. Miracle Christmas
programme.desc: When a family faces loneliness and loss of faith, Mrs. Miracle swoops in to renew their Christmas Spirit, and they experience a holiday of heavenly proportions.

programme.title: Time For Him to Come Home for Christmas
programme.desc: Four days before Christmas, Elizabeth receives a voicemail from a number she doesn't recognize. On the message, a man she doesn't know makes one final plea to the love of his life.

programme.title: In Merry Measure
programme.desc: When pop star Darcy returns home to spend Christmas with her sister and niece, she unexpectedly finds herself coaching the high school choir with her onetime rival, Adam.

programme.title: Record Breaking Christmas
programme.desc: Leah is forced to travel to a small town to investigate its plans to break multiple holiday world records. Later, she discovers that she may be the person who can help them reach their true Christmas goal.

programme.title: Four Christmases and a Wedding
programme.desc: When event planner Chloe is hired to plan the local Christmas Festival, she is beyond thrilled to embrace the challenge.

programme.title: A Royal Corgi Christmas
programme.desc: Prince Edmond hopes to win his mother's love back with the gift of an adorable but unruly corgi. He hires American dog trainer Cecily to make the corgi presentable for the annual Christmas ball.

programme.title: Well Suited for Christmas
programme.desc: Rachel Rocca is a fashion designer who must dress the city's most eligible bachelor Brett Stone, for a Christmas charity gala. As she works on it, she finds out the actual reason behind his charity...

programme.title: Majestic Christmas
programme.desc: Christmas in the charming town of Briar Falls will be bittersweet this year when architect Nell goes back to her hometown having been given the job of turning the historic Majestic Playhouse into a modern multiplex.

programme.title: Marrying Father Christmas
programme.desc: When Miranda Chester set off to find information on her biological father two Christmases ago, she never imagined that her investigation would lead her to the family she had always longed for and the love of her life.

programme.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus
programme.desc: A highwayman steals "lupins" from the rich and tries to give them to the poor. Also: the first episode in a tatty, tedious 18th-century serial is brought to a screeching halt; peasants clamor for Titian paintings and Venetian glass.

programme.title: Monty Python and the Holy Grail
programme.desc: Grossing the highest box-office of any British film in the US when released in 1975, this "cult classic" comedy from the Monty Python team loosely follows the legend of King Arthur, along with his squire and his Knights of the Round Table.

programme.desc: A teen (Brenton Thwaites) discovers the dark truth about his community's secret past from an old man (Jeff Bridges) who is the sole keeper of their world's memories.

programme.title: Divergent
programme.desc: In a future society, people are divided into factions based on their personalities. After a young woman (Shailene Woodley) learns she is a Divergent and will never fit into any one group, she uncovers a conspiracy to destroy all those like her.

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Insurgent
programme.desc: Fugitives Tris (Shailene Woodley) and Four (Theo James) search for allies and answers among the ruins of Chicago while arduously trying to evade Jeanine (Kate Winslet), leader of the Erudites.

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant
programme.desc: As a ruthless battle threatens humanity, Tris (Shailene Woodley) and Four (Theo James) journey beyond the wall that encloses Chicago to find a peaceful solution for their embroiled city.

programme.title: The Fifth Estate
programme.desc: The top-notch team of hosts Bob McKeown, Gillian Findlay, Mark Kelley and Habiba Nosheen provides unique and engaging documentaries from Canada and beyond. "The Fifth Estate" is a reference to the term Fourth Estate, and was chosen to highlight the program's determination to go beyond everyday news into original journalism. The series has won numerous awards for its reporting, including Gemini Awards, International Emmys, the Michener Award, and even an Academy Award for a 1981 episode that was released in theaters the following year. Since September 1975, Canadians have tuned in to experience interesting stories that are always well-crafted and thought-provoking.

programme.title: Marketplace
programme.desc: Canada's consumer watchdog series since 1972, this news program uncovers wrongdoings in the marketplace. With the help of hidden cameras, correspondents dish out the dirt on not so "clean" business practices. Once they get the evidence they need on tape, they apply pressure on businesses to change policies vis-a-vis the products and services they provide to the public.

programme.title: Cuba - Brilliantly Caribbean
programme.desc: Even anyone who has not yet been to Cuba can conjure up certain images of American vintage street cruisers, imposing buildings that have seen better days, white sandy beaches full of palms and loving couples on the MalecÃ³n against a backdrop of crashing waves. This island is somewhat of a myth and its people generate a special joie de vivre. The legendary Hershey Train departs for Matanzas from the capital, Havana. On the oldest electrified railway line in the Caribbean, 60-year-old Spanish carriages make their way along al-most 100 kilometres of coastline in the most relaxed way possible. The Salvavidas on Varadero, probably the most famous beach on the island, have a particular-ly beautiful workplace. The lifeguards' territory ex-tends for more than 20 kilometres. In order to protect the coasts of Cuba, mangroves have been replanted here for many years. The project is supported by the UN and planting is often carried out by schoolchildren. In doing so, Cuban children learn how to treat their maritime habitat in a sustainable fashion. The former colonial city of Trinidad on Cuba's south coast is gen-erally considered to be one of the most beautiful places in the entire Caribbean. The houses here are particular-ly colourful. A plethora of magnificent buildings can be seen at the Plaza Mayor, the neo-baroque main square.

programme.title: mareTV: The Caribbean for explorers: St. Vincent and the Grenadines
programme.desc: Much more Caribbean than on the islands of St. Vincent and the Grenadines is hardly possible. Deserted beaches, uninhabited islands, lush vegetation, the 33 islands in total are dreamlike with extremely hospitable inhabitants. Miranda Phillips runs a laundry and water boat on Bequia. Every morning, the 32-year-old navigates from yacht to yacht with her small bright green service vehicle and is already expected by most skippers. Miranda promises radiantly fresh laundry, which she delivers again the same day. And so there is always something going on in her tiny laundrette in the harbour. It turns into a karaoke bar in the evening, because that is Miranda's great passion. Eban Olliver has many jobs at once. He is the lighthouse keeper of Kingstown. And that means a lot of responsibility in St. Vincent's biggest port city. Because Eban doesn't just change the light bulbs, he's a pilot dispatcher, harbour master and guard all in one person. First contact with ships is particularly important. Once he even saved the entire nation from an Ebola virus.

programme.title: The Heart of Hawaii - The Island of Oahu
programme.desc: The Oahu island is the economic and cultural centre of the Hawaiian archipelago, as well as being a paradise for surfers, active holidaymakers and freedom lovers. The island is home to more than half of all natives and almost eight million foreign guests annually. Anyone searching for peace and seclusion wonâ€™t find either in Honolulu or Waikiki. Traffic congestion and a backdrop of skyscrapers belong to the town panorama. Hip cafes, galleries and young fashion firms have settled here, adding a new and modern flair to the capital. Cindyâ€™s Lei Shoppe, the Chinatown florists, has been here for more than 30 years. This is also because the so-called Leis, the tradition of floral decoration, usually offered as a flower necklace or as a headdress, is still an important part of Hawaiian culture. Keone Nunes is well-known for his traditional tattooing skills, whereby the so-called Kakau Tattoos are virtually hammered into the skin with a hippo tooth. But Oahu is also an island of overwhelming natural beauty and a fascinating diversity on the smallest of places ...

programme.title: The Seychelles - Africa with South Seas ambience
programme.desc: The 115 islands and islets that make up the Seychelles present a breath-taking variety of plants, rare animals and beaches laced with palms. This is where the leg-endary Coco de Mer palm nuts grow with fruits weigh-ing up to 20 kilos and giant wild land turtles nibble away at mangrove fruits to their hearts content. The archipelago was first settled at the end of the 18th cen-tury. Today, a very colourful potpourri of peoples in this dwarf state proves just how peacefully different cultures can live side by side. Three times a week, the steamer "MV Espoir" completes the trip from the main island of MahÃ© to Praslin and back. A ship for every-one and practically everything: Used cars, toilet paper, horses, bicycles, furniture - you name it, the Espoir transports goods of all kinds. Coconuts sometimes pose a problem as there are far too many of them. What to do with them? The best place to send them is undoubt-edly Hubert Roumien's Virgin Coconut Oil Laboratory, hidden away in the MahÃ© jungle. Straw turns into gold at Seaweed Seychelles! There, Benjamin Port Louis collects seaweed and extracts liquid fertiliser from it.

programme.title: Sri Lanka - Tropics, temples and tea plantations
programme.desc: Sri Lanka stands for colourful diversity in all respects. If it's spirituality or Ayurveda you're looking for, here it is. Adventurers and nature lovers can also satisfy their needs here. No one must travel far to discover exotic worlds on this drop-shaped tropical island. "mareTV" delves into the day to day lives of the is-landers, some of whom pursue the most unusual pro-fessions: Uditha Lakmaal is a palm tree climber. He harvests the sap of the trees, known as palm wine, by climbing to the top of them. Sri Lankan stilt fishermen now actually have very little to do with fish and func-tion more as models receiving payment from tourists for acting the part. Anulawathie runs a small floating hoop business, offering car inner tubes for adults and tuk-tuk tubes for children. Different varieties of tea can be found on Herman Gunaratnes tea plantation. Just four carefully selected women are allowed to harvest the exclusive white tea grown there. Each tea leaf is cut individually from the bush by gloved hands and with golden scissors.

programme.title: mareTV: Hong Kong - Metropolis in the sea
programme.desc: Hong Kong translated means "fragrant harbour". The days of the spicy smoking ceremonies have passed, but MareTV has discovered many delightful contrasts between the metropolis and Mother Nature. In for-mer times, the rare eagle wood tree grew here. Its wood put the spice into the Taoist smoking ceremonies. The fragrant harbour: what sounds so charming is today a huge metropolis in the sea. No other tiny piece of land is more densely populated. Star Ferries have been commuting between the Kowloon Peninsula and central Hong Kong for the past 125 years. The British colonial masters are long gone, but on the ancient ferries, virtually nothing has changed. Most of the ships are still clad in British Racing Green and the crew still wears the old, decorative uniforms.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Zanzibar
programme.desc: Photographer Matthias Ziegler is an Africa specialist. He has visited nearly every country on the continent on assignments for international agencies. Zanzibar, however, is new territory for him. He's come to the former slave island for a photo book â€“ and this time he's not alone. To see the Tanzanian archipelago from the air, he has enlisted the services of ultralight pilot Richard Meredith-Hardy of England to fly him around in his FIB, or flying inflatable boat. Perfect conditions for an adventurous journey: as a world champion ultralight pilot, Richard and his FIB can take off and land practically anywhere â€“ in theory.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Mauritius
programme.desc: Renaud Van Der Meeren is a photographer and paramotor pilot. With his motorised parachute he goes on expeditions to the remotest corners on earth to photograph people and landscapes from the air. Renaud wanted to be a jet pilot, studied music at the Sorbonne, became a ski instructor, model and photographer's assistant before he found happiness in his current vocation. He especially likes to do his job in Mauritius â€“ nowhere else does he find so many motifs as on the "sweetest pearl in the Indian Ocean". This time he's working on a photo book about Mauritius â€“ by land, by water and in the air.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Madagascar
programme.desc: Spirits, Kings, Lemurs â€“ Madagascar treats Ami to a multitude of new impressions and spectacular pictures. Director Christian Schidlowski and his team accompanied her on her trip.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Sao Tome and Principe
programme.desc: Along with photographer Rui Camilo, we travel to the West African island nation of Sao TomÃ© and PrÃ­ncipe - in search of images that will capture the soul of this small and beautiful country.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Cape Verde
programme.desc: Cape Verde â€“ the islands of Saudade, of longing. For StÃ©phane and Richard it was a journey full of adventure, unforgettable encounters and magnificent photographs. Director Christian Schidlowski and his team accompanied them on their trip.

programme.title: mareTV: Martinique
programme.desc: The island of Martinique is a piece of France in the Caribbean, between Florida and South America. And of course, Savoir-vivre applies just as it does on the other side of the Atlantic, between the English Channel and the Mediterranean. Jacky Pascault is the first and only man to cultivate mushrooms in the Caribbean. Everywhere else, they grow on artificially fertilised soil, but Jacky's Champignons Tropicaux flourish on sugar cane fibres. Nicole Vilo tailors hats and dresses out of coconut palms. Of course, the catwalk for the models wearing her first collection is one of the countless dream beaches. The Martiniquais sail on boats they call Yole, which have no keel and are therefore difficult to navigate. The crew members hang over the water in breakneck fashion on long wooden poles. Just the job for Yole-boss Max' "problem kids": they not only learn complicated handling, but also team spirit.

programme.title: mareTV: Curacao, Blue Wonder of the Caribbean
programme.desc: Curacao is one of the most popular attractions for countless cruise ships on their trips through the Caribbean, because it is located outside of the hurricane belt. This is why Eric Miguel is constantly in action. He is the bridge keeper of the Queen Emma Bridge, the landmark of Curacao's capital, Willemstad. After his shift, Eric goes to Yvonne Troeman's cook-shop. Her speciality is Kadushi, a cactus soup. The ingredients include cactus flesh, pigtail's, mussels and a few secret "treats". Barbara van Bebber is the only submarine pilot on Curacao and literally gets to the bottom of things amidst the turquoise-blue wonder of the Caribbean. She charters out her sub to marine biologists and wealthy private explorers, simultaneously cleaning up on the seabed. Her "Curasub" has claw arms, which she employs to remove anything that doesn't belong down there: beer bottles, car tyres, and plastic refuse. Jeroen Eikelenboom simply carts sand from a neighbouring cove to his own surf club in his favourite bay.

programme.title: mareTV: Mexico's Caribbean Coast
programme.desc: The palm tree laden beaches on Mexico's Riviera Maya on the Yucatan peninsula are endless, and the turquoise sea with its gentle Caribbean surf is a warm 25 degrees during the mild winter in this part of the world. Between CancÃºn and Punta Allen, where once there was little more than bushland and a few sleepy fishing villages, vibrant life has evolved during the past three decades. Richard Sowa has lived on a floating island for the past 15 years: an island he built himself out of empty plastic bottles. The bon vivant him-self sees it as a "solution for our planet's refuse problem". Off Punta Allen, a village in the bay of Sian Ka'an, Mexican Mara Coral Ley and her cousin Kim, continue to catch lobsters by adhering to the traditional method and were awarded an "Eco seal for sustainable fishing" for their trouble. It is silent under water off Isla Mujeres and it is here that the artist Jason deCaires has constructed a sculpture park. Hundreds of lifesize figures form an artificial reef at a depth of 12 metres. Fish and plants complete his work of art. The master himself is convinced: "Mother Nature is the true artist".

programme.title: Caribbean sisters: The Lesser Antilles St. Kitts & Nevis
programme.desc: In the centre of the Caribbean, volcanoes rise steeply from the sea, thus shaping the sister islands of St. Kitts & Nevis. Their slopes, covered in lush rainforests, snow-white, sandy beaches and the surrounding tur-quoise tinted waters provide the ultimate setting for this record-breaking, albeit tiny island paradise: Both islets are the smallest of the Caribbean dwarf states and also rank among the worldâ€™s ten smallest states. A hot pepper sauce, made of a creative mixture of ginger, garlic, thyme and extraordinarily hot chillies that thrive in the hot and humid climate of Nevis, is simmering on the stove of Violet and Llewellynâ€™s house. Lemmy Pemberton digs up abandoned turtle nests with his bare hands, as he wants to be certain that all of the babies have indeed managed to make it. Members of the Turtle Group catch sea turtles in order to take their measurements and fit them with transmitters. Taxi bus-es are not only the main means of transport on St. Kitts & Nevis, they are also an artistic expression of each driverâ€™s personality. Colourfully embellished, each taxi represents island art on wheels.

A plethora of magnificent buildings can be seen at the Plaza Mayor, the neo-baroque main square.

programme.desc: The Oahu island is the economic and cultural centre of the Hawaiian archipelago, as well as being a paradise for surfers, active holidaymakers and freedom lovers. The island is home to more than half of all natives and almost eight million foreign guests annually. Anyone searching for peace and seclusion wonâ€™t find either in Honolulu or Waikiki. Traffic congestion and a backdrop of skyscrapers belong to the town panorama. Hip cafes, galleries and young fashion firms have settled here, adding a new and modern flair to the capital. Cindyâ€™s Lei Shoppe, the Chinatown florists, has been here for more than 30 years. This is also because the so-called Leis, the tradition of floral decoration, usually offered as a flower necklace or as a headdress, is still an important part of Hawaiian culture. Keone Nunes is well-known for his traditional tattooing skills, whereby the so-called Kakau Tattoos are virtually hammered into the skin with a hippo tooth. But Oahu is also an island of overwhelming natural beauty and a fascinating diversity on the smallest of places ...

programme.title: The Seychelles - Africa with South Seas ambience
programme.desc: The 115 islands and islets that make up the Seychelles present a breath-taking variety of plants, rare animals and beaches laced with palms. This is where the leg-endary Coco de Mer palm nuts grow with fruits weigh-ing up to 20 kilos and giant wild land turtles nibble away at mangrove fruits to their hearts content. The archipelago was first settled at the end of the 18th cen-tury. Today, a very colourful potpourri of peoples in this dwarf state proves just how peacefully different cultures can live side by side. Three times a week, the steamer "MV Espoir" completes the trip from the main island of MahÃ© to Praslin and back. A ship for every-one and practically everything: Used cars, toilet paper, horses, bicycles, furniture - you name it, the Espoir transports goods of all kinds. Coconuts sometimes pose a problem as there are far too many of them. What to do with them? The best place to send them is undoubt-edly Hubert Roumien's Virgin Coconut Oil Laboratory, hidden away in the MahÃ© jungle. Straw turns into gold at Seaweed Seychelles! There, Benjamin Port Louis collects seaweed and extracts liquid fertiliser from it.

programme.title: Sri Lanka - Tropics, temples and tea plantations
programme.desc: Sri Lanka stands for colourful diversity in all respects. If it's spirituality or Ayurveda you're looking for, here it is. Adventurers and nature lovers can also satisfy their needs here. No one must travel far to discover exotic worlds on this drop-shaped tropical island. "mareTV" delves into the day to day lives of the is-landers, some of whom pursue the most unusual pro-fessions: Uditha Lakmaal is a palm tree climber. He harvests the sap of the trees, known as palm wine, by climbing to the top of them. Sri Lankan stilt fishermen now actually have very little to do with fish and func-tion more as models receiving payment from tourists for acting the part. Anulawathie runs a small floating hoop business, offering car inner tubes for adults and tuk-tuk tubes for children. Different varieties of tea can be found on Herman Gunaratnes tea plantation. Just four carefully selected women are allowed to harvest the exclusive white tea grown there. Each tea leaf is cut individually from the bush by gloved hands and with golden scissors.

programme.title: mareTV: Hong Kong - Metropolis in the sea
programme.desc: Hong Kong translated means "fragrant harbour". The days of the spicy smoking ceremonies have passed, but MareTV has discovered many delightful contrasts between the metropolis and Mother Nature. In for-mer times, the rare eagle wood tree grew here. Its wood put the spice into the Taoist smoking ceremonies. The fragrant harbour: what sounds so charming is today a huge metropolis in the sea. No other tiny piece of land is more densely populated. Star Ferries have been commuting between the Kowloon Peninsula and central Hong Kong for the past 125 years. The British colonial masters are long gone, but on the ancient ferries, virtually nothing has changed. Most of the ships are still clad in British Racing Green and the crew still wears the old, decorative uniforms.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Zanzibar
programme.desc: Photographer Matthias Ziegler is an Africa specialist. He has visited nearly every country on the continent on assignments for international agencies. Zanzibar, however, is new territory for him. He's come to the former slave island for a photo book â€“ and this time he's not alone. To see the Tanzanian archipelago from the air, he has enlisted the services of ultralight pilot Richard Meredith-Hardy of England to fly him around in his FIB, or flying inflatable boat. Perfect conditions for an adventurous journey: as a world champion ultralight pilot, Richard and his FIB can take off and land practically anywhere â€“ in theory.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Mauritius
programme.desc: Renaud Van Der Meeren is a photographer and paramotor pilot. With his motorised parachute he goes on expeditions to the remotest corners on earth to photograph people and landscapes from the air. Renaud wanted to be a jet pilot, studied music at the Sorbonne, became a ski instructor, model and photographer's assistant before he found happiness in his current vocation. He especially likes to do his job in Mauritius â€“ nowhere else does he find so many motifs as on the "sweetest pearl in the Indian Ocean". This time he's working on a photo book about Mauritius â€“ by land, by water and in the air.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Madagascar
programme.desc: Spirits, Kings, Lemurs â€“ Madagascar treats Ami to a multitude of new impressions and spectacular pictures. Director Christian Schidlowski and his team accompanied her on her trip.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Sao Tome and Principe
programme.desc: Along with photographer Rui Camilo, we travel to the West African island nation of Sao TomÃ© and PrÃ­ncipe - in search of images that will capture the soul of this small and beautiful country.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Cape Verde
programme.desc: Cape Verde â€“ the islands of Saudade, of longing. For StÃ©phane and Richard it was a journey full of adventure, unforgettable encounters and magnificent photographs. Director Christian Schidlowski and his team accompanied them on their trip.

programme.title: mareTV: Martinique
programme.desc: The island of Martinique is a piece of France in the Caribbean, between Florida and South America. And of course, Savoir-vivre applies just as it does on the other side of the Atlantic, between the English Channel and the Mediterranean. Jacky Pascault is the first and only man to cultivate mushrooms in the Caribbean. Everywhere else, they grow on artificially fertilised soil, but Jacky's Champignons Tropicaux flourish on sugar cane fibres. Nicole Vilo tailors hats and dresses out of coconut palms. Of course, the catwalk for the models wearing her first collection is one of the countless dream beaches. The Martiniquais sail on boats they call Yole, which have no keel and are therefore difficult to navigate. The crew members hang over the water in breakneck fashion on long wooden poles. Just the job for Yole-boss Max' "problem kids": they not only learn complicated handling, but also team spirit.
